subject: Coming to LA
event:
Looks like I will be coming out to LA in early January, to talk about the HBO show at the TCA.

That one is for television critics only, I'm afraid... but I'm looking to set up a couple of public events while I am in town.  Watch this space.  We will probably do a signing, most likely somewhere in the San Fernando Valley.  And our friend Lodengarl, founder and prince of the Brotherhood Without Banners, is going to come down from the Bay Area to organize a BWB event the same day.  Details when we have 'em... but angelenos, mark down January 9 on your calendars.

(Might have an exciting announcement that day as well.  Maybe two.  But don't quote me on that).

props.taglist: appearances, signings, hbo, game of thrones

comments.article: Please don't be messing with us again.  That would be so uncool I don't even know if there's a way to describe it in human terms.
comments.subject: Please

comments.article: Completely agree.
comments.subject: Re: Please

comments.article:
Yay!

I'd love it if you came to Vroman's in Pasadena. It's my local bookstore and the largest independent bookstore in Southern California. I can't wait for the new series (and the new book) ;)
I have to second the desire to see you at Vroman's, if not this trip, than another one sometime. Vroman's is a truly wonderful bookstore. I always feel good about spending my money there!

I only wish you could make it to the Northwest as well. Can't wait to see the characters walk into existence via HBO. As to your announcement, no pressure from this fan, encouragement perhaps, hope certainly. Do what must be done, for it needs doing ;-)
comments.subject: Congrats on season 1 !!

comments.article:
Seconded! Please do come to the Northwest if possible, in the future! That would be fantastic! Portland would love to have you, and I'm sure you have a avid (slash, you know, rabid) fan-base here. Plus Portland is nice and laid back and has great coffee and Powells.

In regard to your earlier post, thank you very much for updating us- it's very kind of you to do so.
comments.subject: Re: Congrats on season 1 !!

comments.article: !!! I am in the Valley!!! Best. News. Ever!

comments.upictitle: Rum, Sodomy, and the Lash: Pick Two: monkey pirate
comments.article: I'll be at the BWB gathering for sure. Lodey, if you read this, drop me a line and I'll help with planning if you need it.
does the announcement involve the show or books?
comments.subject: whoa

comments.article:
I am so excited I am screaming like a 10 year old girl!

I WONDER what those two possible announcements might be...
comments.subject: eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeekkk

comments.article: Please let the exciting announcement be that the book is done... (crossing fingers and saying a little prayer to the book gods of the universe).
comments.subject: done

comments.article: announcement... well, there's only one announcement that matters, so how can there be two? :-) something about dancing...I hope

Let it be ADWD publishing date, what a way to start off a New Year that would be!

By the way Mr. Martin can you recommend any good steampunk novels? I am considering eBooking "Boneshaker", have heard some good things about it. Just finished Joe Abercrombie's First Law trilogy (loved it) - and needing a change of pace.

Merry Christmas!
comments.subject: Oh please, oh please

comments.article: "We will definitely have an exciting announcement on January 9, 2011. Maybe two." - GRRM
I never quote you George unless I see it in print on a shelf.
Yay! I live in the SFV!! As a valley girl, I heartily welcome your presence. :)
Juicy! Here's hoping exciting announcements are in the works..

Please refer to the thread on the A Song of Ice and Fire message board: http://asoiaf.westeros.org/index.php/topic/46733-la-bwb-time-to-gather-with-george/ for updates and plans.

We are organizing a Sunday, Jan 9th BwB evening event in the San Fernando Valley. Head over to the above thread, put in your RSVP, give suggestions, and help make this a great event - conversation, food, drink, relaxation and contemplation will be in order.

The BwB has always been an open fan club for those that want to have a good time, meet new people, and enjoy fandom the way it was meant to be enjoyed. Looking forward to a great turnout in LA!
comments.subject: LA  BwB Gathering - Come Join the Fandom Fun

comments.article:
Lodey- I passed this on to Erik and Tav... I think I found a venue. I met this guy whose wife had a baby at my hospital. He's a recently retired NFL coach (Patriots!) who opened a New Haven style pizza place in Burbank. Don't we know someone who likes pizza and football?

I checked it out with my family tonight and the pizza is really good. http://www.caminitipizza.com

What do you think?
comments.subject: Re: LA  BwB Gathering - Come Join the Fandom Fun
Re: LA  BwB Gathering - Come Join the Fandom Fun
Re: LA  BwB Gathering - Come Join the Fandom Fun

comments.article:
quote yah :)

This sounds great!
comments.subject: "Might have an exciting announcement that day as well. Maybe two. But don't quote me on that"

comments.article:
I hope "A Game of Thrones" runs at least seven seasons. HBO really dropped the ball when they let Deadwood, Rome and Carnivale end without proper finales. I still can't believe David Milich dropped Deadwood so he could do John From Cincinatti.

It sure looks like groundbreaking stuff. I'm a big fan of Lena Headey's work on Connor Chronicles and Sean Bean is the biggest actor in England.

But you must feel like its kind of a race now to get the other books done. I look forward to seeing what you have to say when the show is in its last year. It's possible that the series could get to the conclusion before the last two books are out. I know it's still far off but I can't stop wondering what's gonna happen.

As long as the show is the best show it can be and the books are given careful revision, it doesn't really matter which one makes it to the finish line first. I'd rather have to wait another ten years for book seven than have it be disappointing because it wasn't given enough time for revision.

I guess the race is on...
comments.subject: The Finish Line

comments.article: Of course you are coming to LA when I am deployed! Drat! Perhaps you will return to the area some time this summer!
comments.subject: Oh no!d

comments.article: I'm 20 years old, and I've been following you blog for almost 7 years, literally a third of my life.  I never ever have felt the need to comment on anything, but I had to today.  I think I know your posts well enough now that this is it.  You're done!  You must be looking it over and deciding to announce it on the 9th, but I'm willing to bet you're done now.  I don't know why I'm so certain, but I just have never been more excited.  Can't wait until it hits the stores! Send me the manuscript maybe! : ) lol.  Awesome work!
comments.subject: You're Done!

comments.article:
Just as filming wraps in Belfast we have had the heaviest snowfall in Norn Iron for 25 years.

I hope a few enterprising HBO cameramen went to the Mournes to shoot some footage...

Merry Christmas George.
If the good news is the good news I believe it to be, we will all be DANCING soon
comments.subject: Good news

comments.article: I'll definitely be at the singing. Hopefully you'll have some good dance news by then ;)
comments.subject: Can't wait to see you!

comments.article: George will sing?

comments.article: The show is looking unbelievably awesome. Of course everyone is hoping that the exciting announcement can be only one thing. I am hoping it is that one thing as well but I don't think anyone noticed the "But don't quote me on that" or have chosen to completely ignore it. Should be interesting. :)

Please let us know if you are coming to NYC...

I want to be an actor in this series so bad! www.joshadamdavis.com...

Doesn;t matter if Im just a corpse... Would love to be involved in season two!

Can't wait till the next book!!!
comments.subject: Come to NY

comments.article: Yay, I am so excited!! I hope you are able to do a few things in L.A. while you are here, I know there are many of us who would love the opportunity to meet you. Keeping my eye open on the BwB forum for when a location is figured out.
